inclusion.criterion: American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) Physical Status Classification
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: surgically sterilized, or pre-menopausal with negative pregnancy test within 7 days before study
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: male, 18-55 years old with more than 3 risk factors for PONV
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: undergoing outpatient laparoscopic gynecological surgery or laparoscopic abdominal surgery, scheduled for between 1 and 3 hours duration
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: known history of post-operative nausea and vomiting and/or motion sickness
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: non-smoker for at least the previous 12 consecutive months
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: able and willing to complete subject diary until end of 96 Hour Follow-Up Assessment period
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: available to respond to follow-up by study personnel at 72 and 96 hours post emergence from anesthesia
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: ASA Physical Status Classification of IV or V
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: taking more than 10-15mg of oxycodone, or equivalent opioid dose, on a regular daily basis for more than 3 consecutive days before surgery
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: received investigational drug in the previous 30 days or scheduled to receive any investigational drug during study period
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: persistent or recurrent nausea and/or vomiting due to other etiologies, including gastric outlet obstruction, hypercalcemia, active peptic ulcer, increased intracranial pressure, or brain metastases
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: experienced retching or vomiting or uncontrolled nausea within 48 hours before administration of study drug
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: received medication with known or potential antiemetic activity within 24 hours before receiving study drug
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: radiation therapy to abdomen or pelvis in the 7 days prior to receiving study medication and/or will receive radiation therapy to abdomen or pelvis in evaluation period
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient is a 17-year-old boy with severe migratory pain in the right lower quadrant of his abdomen, accompanied by nausea and vomiting. He has been diagnosed with acute perforated appendicitis and is now a candidate for emergent laparoscopic appendectomy under general anesthesia.
